intro: Daiswa pubescens, commonly known as the hairy daisies, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its scientific name. It produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in a head, typical of the family. Daiswa pubescens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
